oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Isaac Shelby to John Sevier
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter from Isaac Shelby to John Sevier enclosing a memorial to the North Carolina legislature for swords and pistols, October 3, 1812.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Revolutions; Correspondence; Memorial rites & ceremonies; Daggers & swords
United States--Hitory--Revolution, 1775-1783; Sevier, John, 1745-1815; Shelby, Isaac, 1750-1826
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Often called the "Father of Tennessee," John Sevier was born in Virginia, but eventually moved to Washington County, North Carolina [later Tennessee]. Sevier became a hero after he, Shelby, and William Campbell led armed settlers against the British at the Battle of Kings Mountain (1780). Sevier served as Tennessee's first governor; Isaac Shelby was Kentucky's first and fifth governor.
